page.title: 10McARTHUR MARATHON, DERVOCK.
page.content: The{McArthur Memorial Marathon}was run in Dervock on 14th July 1984, in memory of{K.K.Mc Arthur,}who was born in Dervock, and won the Gold Medal in the Olympic Marathon at Stockholm, on 14th July 1912. To allow more people to take part, there was also a five mile fun run and a half-marathon. There were over 300 entries in the 3 events. 2 members of the{McArthur {Marathon Klub, Potchefstroom, South {Africa,}(where McArthur had emigrated in 1905), ran in the main event. There were a couple of showers before the start_dry and cool during the race_ but with a stiff breeze. The largest crowds seen in the village, since {McArthur}returned with his gold medal, thronged the streets.{Billy Gallagher won in a time of 2 hr 27 min 40 sec. It is hoped to make this an annual event, on the 2nd Saturday of July.
